intro: Adinandra brassii, commonly known as the African ironwood, is a small evergreen tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, hard wood that is highly valued for its durability. The plant has simple, opposite leaves that are often leathery in texture. It produces small, white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, followed by small, round berries. Adinandra brassii is typically found in moist, well-drained soils in forested areas.
